title: compile-time: massive regression during 2015

labels.name: I-compiletime
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to compile times.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I noticed earlier that the compile time of `image` increased massively during the beginning of 2015. Unfortunately it was hard to quantify this regression since we also changed a lot during this time. 

Fortunately I just found a good example that shows a 20-fold increase in compile time. It is a [single file](https://gist.github.com/nwin/b0b8bb23040a526b5b59) with no other dependencies (if somebody wants to try: the [original version](https://github.com/cmr/TEMP-rust-png) is even much older). The two revisions are exactly the same code, the newer just has been updated to compile on a recent rustc. Note that this is `rustc` only, no time is spend in llvm.

```
$ sudo rustc --version
rustc 0.13.0-nightly (7608dbad6 2014-12-31 10:06:21 -0800)
$ time sudo rustc --crate-type=lib -Z no-trans inflate.rs

real    0m1.176s
user    0m1.059s
sys 0m0.113s
```

(note that something is wrong with the old .pkg-file I used to install rustc, I need to use sudo to run it)

```
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.1.0-nightly (c4b23aec4 2015-04-29) (built 2015-04-28)
$ time rustc --crate-type=lib -Z no-trans inflate.rs

real    0m25.208s
user    0m23.919s
sys 0m1.213s
```

The [time profiles](https://gist.github.com/nwin/016c7e64ae270f519cdb) show that `driver::phase_1_parse_input` and `driver::phase_2_configure_and_expand` almost stayed constant while the time spent in `driver::phase_3_run_analysis_passes` exploded.
